question: which greek god flew too close to the sun
vanilla_rag_result: The Greek god who is often associated with flying too close to the sun is Icarus. In Greek mythology, Icarus is the son of Daedalus, who crafted wings made of feathers and wax for them to escape from Crete. Icarus, ignoring his father's warnings, flew too high, causing the sun to melt the wax in his wings, leading to his fall into the sea.
